attributes.action: Increase income tax for mid-high earners and reduce income tax for NHS staff
attributes.additional_details:
NHS staff are vital to our country over the coming months

I am lucky to earn enough to be in the 40% tax bracket and have the option to safely work from home. 'Redeployment' for them comes with more sacrifices and stress than the majority of us

The NHS runs on good will and for years people have worked overtime to ensure good patient care. With little financial compensation over the last few years, a tax increase for those who can afford it would be a small, but meaningful, way to be thankful
attributes.background: I would like to propose paying higher income tax for those in the 40% / 45% so that this money can be 'redeployed' to NHS workers which will give them some monetary relief as a small thank you for the sacrifices they are making.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

Increase taxes on high earners to fund emergency Budget measures: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305795

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
